dcterms:creator: Hamid R Sheikh
Muhammad F Sabir
Alan C Bovik
dcterms:description: The LIVE dataset contains 29 reference images with resolutions ranging from 438 × 634 pixels to 512 × 768 pixels. These images were manually simulated to produce 5 different types of distorted images, totaling 779 images. Distortion types include JPEG2000 distortion, JPEG distortion, white noise distortion, Gaussian blur distortion, and fast Rayleigh decay distortion. The dataset provides the Differential Mean Opinion Score (DMOS) for all distorted images in the range [0, 100], where 0 means no distortion.
dcterms:title: LIVE

dcterms:creator: Nikolay Ponomarenko
Vladimir Lukin
Alexander Zelensky
Karen Egiazarian
Marco Carli
Federica Battisti
dcterms:description: TID2008 includes 25 color reference images with a resolution of 384 × 512 pixels, with 17 distortion types, each containing four different levels of distortion, for a total of 1700 images. The dataset provides MOS values and their standard deviations for all tested images, with MOS values in the range [0, 9], where 9 means that the image is distortion-free.
dcterms:title: TID2008

dcterms:creator: Nikolay Ponomarenko
Oleg Ieremeiev
Vladimir Lukin
Karen Egiazarian
Lina Jin
Jaakko Astola
Benoit Vozel
Kacem Chehdi
Marco Carli
Federica Battisti
dcterms:description: TID2013 includes 25 reference images, 3000 distorted images (including 25 reference images with 24 distortions simulated manually for each image, each with 5 levels of distortion). The annotation type for this dataset is DMOS, which is obtained statistically from 524,340 samples observed by 971 observers, with DMOS values ranging from [0, 9], with larger values indicating poorer image quality.
dcterms:title: TID2013

dcterms:creator: Eric Cooper Larson
Damon Michael Chandler
dcterms:description: CSIQ contains 30 reference images with a resolution of 512 pixels × 512 pixels and six types of distortion, including overall contrast reduction, JPEG compression, JPEG2000 compression, additive Gaussian pink noise, additive Gaussian white noise, and Gaussian blur. The dataset provides the DMOS values for all the images tested, obtained from several subjective ratings by 25 testers.
dcterms:title: CSIQ

dcterms:creator: Dinesh Jayaraman
Anish Mittal
Anush K Moorthy
Alan C Bovik
dcterms:description: The LIVE MD database is the first database containing multiple distorted images created by the LIVE Lab at the University of Texas at Austin. It contains 15 reference and 450 distorted images and provides a DMOS for each distorted image, taking values in the range [0, 100].
dcterms:title: LIVE MD

dcterms:creator: Deepti Ghadiyaram
Alan C Bovik
dcterms:description: The LIVE In the Wild Image Quality Challenge Database consists of 1162 images from the Field Image Quality Challenge, created by the LIVE Lab at the University of Texas at Austin. The types of distortion in these images are real images captured using various mobile cameras, subject to a variety of randomly occurring distortions and real photography artifacts.
dcterms:title: LIVE In the Wild Image Quality Challenge Database

dcterms:creator: Hanhe Lin
Vlad Hosu
Dietmar Saupe
dcterms:description: KonIQ-10k was built to address the problem of too small true distortion datasets. It randomly selected approximately 10 million images from the large public multimedia dataset YFCC 100M and filtered 10,073 images for use in building the dataset. The types of distortion present in these images included noise, JPEG artifacts, blending, lens motion blur, over-sharpening, etc.
dcterms:title: KonIQ-10k
